ChatGPT said:

Got it 👍
Right now, your code handles blood requests (patients/hospitals requesting blood), and it updates the status column (accepted, rejected, pending).

But from your note “should take request status whether the donor or blood request is approved or not”, I think you want both donor donation requests and blood requests (from patients/hospitals) to have approval/rejection status in the same way.

Here’s how you can fix it:

1. Add status column in both tables

Make sure both your tables (blood_requests and donor_requests) have a status column:

sql
ALTER TABLE blood_requests ADD COLUMN status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending';
ALTER TABLE donor_requests ADD COLUMN status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending';

2. Update PHP for donor approval

You can create a separate page for donor requests (like donor_status.php), or merge them into one admin panel. Example:

php
// Handle Donor Approve/Reject
if (isset($_GET['donor_action'], $_GET['donor_id'])) {
    $donor_id = (int)$_GET['donor_id'];
    $donor_action = $_GET['donor_action'];

    if ($donor_action === 'accept') {
        $conn->query("UPDATE donor_requests SET status='accepted' WHERE id=$donor_id");
    } elseif ($donor_action === 'reject') {
        $conn->query("UPDATE donor_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$donor_id");
    }
    header("Location: donor_status.php");
    exit();
}

// Fetch all donor requests
$donor_result = $conn->query("
    SELECT id, donor_name, contact, blood_group, units, IFNULL(status,'pending') as status, request_date
    FROM donor_requests
    ORDER BY request_date DESC
");

3. Display donor request table

Add another table below your blood requests:

php
<h2>All Donor Requests</h2>
<table class="table table-bordered table-striped">
<thead class="table-dark">
<tr>
    <th>ID</th>
    <th>Donor Name</th>
    <th>Contact</th>
    <th>Blood Group</th>
    <th>Units</th>
    <th>Status</th>
    <th>Date</th>
    <th>Action</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<?php while($drow = $donor_result->fetch_assoc()){ ?>
<tr>
    <td><?= $drow['id'] ?></td>
    <td><?= htmlspecialchars($drow['donor_name']) ?></td>
    <td><?= htmlspecialchars($drow['contact']) ?></td>
    <td><?= htmlspecialchars($drow['blood_group']) ?></td>
    <td><?= $drow['units'] ?></td>
    <td><span class="badge-status badge-<?= $drow['status'] ?>"><?= ucfirst($drow['status']) ?></span></td>
    <td><?= $drow['request_date'] ?></td>
    <td class="btn-group">
        <?php if($drow['status']=='pending'){ ?>
        <a href="?donor_action=accept&donor_id=<?= $drow['id'] ?>" class="btn btn-success btn-sm">Accept</a>
        <a href="?donor_action=reject&donor_id=<?= $drow['id'] ?>" class="btn btn-danger btn-sm">Reject</a>
        <?php } ?>
    </td>
</tr>
<?php } ?>
<?php if($donor_result->num_rows==0){ ?>
<tr><td colspan="8" class="text-center">No donor requests found.</td></tr>
<?php } ?>
</tbody>
</table>

✅ With this, you’ll have two sections:

  • One table for blood requests (patients/hospitals).

  • One table for donor requests.

Both can now be approved/rejected, and their status will update in the database.

Do you want me to merge donor requests and blood requests in one single table (with an extra column for type), or keep them separate tables like above?

You said:

ChatGPT said:

Perfect 👍 you want donor requests + blood requests in one single table, with an extra column that shows the type of request (like Donor or Patient/Hospital).

Here’s how you can do it:

1. Create a Common Query with UNION

If you already have two tables (blood_requests and donor_requests), you can combine them into one result set using UNION ALL.

php
// Fetch combined requests
$result = $conn->query("
    SELECT id, name AS person_name, contact, address, blood_group, units, 
           IFNULL(status,'pending') as status, request_date, 'Blood Request' AS req_type
    FROM blood_requests

    UNION ALL

    SELECT id, donor_name AS person_name, contact, '' AS address, blood_group, units, 
           IFNULL(status,'pending') as status, request_date, 'Donor Request' AS req_type
    FROM donor_requests

    ORDER BY request_date DESC
");

2. Handle Approval/Reject for Both

We’ll use one set of parameters, but add a type field so the system knows which table to update:

php
// Handle Approve/Reject
if (isset($_GET['action'], $_GET['id'], $_GET['type'])) {
    $id = (int)$_GET['id'];
    $action = $_GET['action'];
    $type = $_GET['type'];

    if ($type === 'blood') {
        if ($action === 'accept') {
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='accepted' WHERE id=$id");
        } elseif ($action === 'reject') {
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        }
    } elseif ($type === 'donor') {
        if ($action === 'accept') {
            $conn->query("UPDATE donor_requests SET status='accepted' WHERE id=$id");
        } elseif ($action === 'reject') {
            $conn->query("UPDATE donor_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        }
    }
    header("Location: request_status.php");
    exit();
}

3. Display Unified Table

Now you only need one table in HTML:

php
<h2>All Requests (Blood + Donor)</h2>
<table class="table table-bordered table-striped">
<thead class="table-dark">
<tr>
    <th>ID</th>
    <th>Type</th>
    <th>Name</th>
    <th>Contact</th>
    <th>Address</th>
    <th>Blood Group</th>
    <th>Units</th>
    <th>Status</th>
    <th>Date</th>
    <th>Action</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<?php while($row = $result->fetch_assoc()){ ?>
<tr>
    <td><?= $row['id'] ?></td>
    <td><?= $row['req_type'] ?></td>
    <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['person_name']) ?></td>
    <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['contact']) ?></td>
    <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['address']) ?></td>
    <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['blood_group']) ?></td>
    <td><?= $row['units'] ?></td>
    <td><span class="badge-status badge-<?= $row['status'] ?>"><?= ucfirst($row['status']) ?></span></td>
    <td><?= $row['request_date'] ?></td>
    <td class="btn-group">
        <?php if($row['status']=='pending'){ ?>
        <a href="?action=accept&id=<?= $row['id'] ?>&type=<?= ($row['req_type']=='Blood Request'?'blood':'donor') ?>" class="btn btn-success btn-sm">Accept</a>
        <a href="?action=reject&id=<?= $row['id'] ?>&type=<?= ($row['req_type']=='Blood Request'?'blood':'donor') ?>" class="btn btn-danger btn-sm">Reject</a>
        <?php } ?>
    </td>
</tr>
<?php } ?>
<?php if($result->num_rows==0){ ?>
<tr><td colspan="10" class="text-center">No requests found.</td></tr>
<?php } ?>
</tbody>
</table>

✅ What this does:

  • Shows both donor requests & patient/hospital blood requests together.

  • Adds a Type column (Donor Request or Blood Request).

  • Lets admin approve/reject either type from the same table.

  • Keeps status updates in their respective tables (donor_requests / blood_requests).

ChatGPT said:

Great — below is a single page solution (request_status.php) that shows Donor Requests and Blood Requests side-by-side (different columns) but on the same page. It accepts approvals/rejections from the same page for both types and supports submissions from Admin and Staff (assumes each request row has a submitted_by column indicating admin or staff — I included SQL to add it if you don't already have it).

All styling is in a separate CSS file styles.css (no inline CSS). The layout uses CSS Grid/flex (px units) and class/id selectors.

1) request_status.php

Save this as request_status.php in your project folder.

php
<?php
// request_status.php
session_start();

// Simple auth check example (adjust to your login logic)
if (!isset($_SESSION['user_id'])) {
    header("Location: loginpage.php");
    exit();
}

// DB connection
$mysqli = new mysqli("localhost","root","","bloodbank");
if ($mysqli->connect_error) {
    die("Connection failed: " . $mysqli->connect_error);
}

// Approve / Reject handler (uses prepared statements)
if (isset($_GET['action'], $_GET['id'], $_GET['type'])) {
    $id = (int)$_GET['id'];
    $action = $_GET['action'] === 'accept' ? 'accepted' : 'rejected';
    $type = $_GET['type'] === 'blood' ? 'blood' : 'donor';

    if ($type === 'blood') {
        $stmt = $mysqli->prepare("UPDATE blood_requests SET status = ? WHERE id = ?");
    } else {
        $stmt = $mysqli->prepare("UPDATE donor_requests SET status = ? WHERE id = ?");
    }
    if ($stmt) {
        $stmt->bind_param("si", $action, $id);
        $stmt->execute();
        $stmt->close();
    }
    header("Location: request_status.php");
    exit();
}

/*
 Combined query: fetch both tables and add columns to unify fields.
 Assumes the following columns exist:
 - blood_requests: id, name, entity_name, contact, address, blood_group, units, status, request_date, submitted_by
 - donor_requests: id, donor_name, contact, address, blood_group, units, status, request_date, submitted_by
 If you don't have 'submitted_by' column, see SQL below to add it.
*/
$query = "
    SELECT id,
           'Blood Request' AS req_type,
           COALESCE(name, entity_name, '') AS person_name,
           contact,
           address,
           blood_group,
           units,
           COALESCE(status, 'pending') AS status,
           request_date,
           COALESCE(submitted_by, 'unknown') AS submitted_by
    FROM blood_requests

    UNION ALL

    SELECT id,
           'Donor Request' AS req_type,
           COALESCE(donor_name, '') AS person_name,
           contact,
           address,
           blood_group,
           units,
           COALESCE(status, 'pending') AS status,
           request_date,
           COALESCE(submitted_by, 'unknown') AS submitted_by
    FROM donor_requests

    ORDER BY request_date DESC
";

$result = $mysqli->query($query);
?>

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <title>All Requests — Blood & Donor</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
<div id="page">
    <header id="page-header">
        <h1 id="title">Requests Dashboard</h1>
        <div id="subtitle">Combined view — Donor Requests & Blood Requests (Admin / Staff)</div>
    </header>

    <main id="main-grid">
        <section id="controls" class="card">
            <h2 class="card-title">Filters</h2>
            <!-- Placeholder: add filter controls if needed -->
            <p class="muted">Filter by type, status or submitter (coming soon)</p>
        </section>

        <section id="requests-section" class="card">
            <h2 class="card-title">All Requests</h2>

            <div id="table-wrap">
                <table id="requests-table" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
                    <thead>
                        <tr>
                            <th class="col-id">ID</th>
                            <th class="col-type">Type</th>
                            <th class="col-name">Name</th>
                            <th class="col-contact">Contact</th>
                            <th class="col-address">Address</th>
                            <th class="col-bgroup">Blood Group</th>
                            <th class="col-units">Units</th>
                            <th class="col-source">From</th>
                            <th class="col-status">Status</th>
                            <th class="col-date">Date</th>
                            <th class="col-action">Action</th>
                        </tr>
                    </thead>
                    <tbody>
                    <?php if ($result && $result->num_rows > 0): ?>
                        <?php while($row = $result->fetch_assoc()): ?>
                            <?php
                                // Determine type param for action links
                                $typeParam = $row['req_type'] === 'Blood Request' ? 'blood' : 'donor';
                                $statusClass = 'badge-pending';
                                if ($row['status'] === 'accepted') $statusClass = 'badge-accepted';
                                if ($row['status'] === 'rejected') $statusClass = 'badge-rejected';
                            ?>
                            <tr class="request-row request-<?= htmlspecialchars(strtolower(str_replace(' ', '-', $row['req_type']))) ?>">
                                <td class="col-id"><?= (int)$row['id'] ?></td>
                                <td class="col-type"><?= htmlspecialchars($row['req_type']) ?></td>
                                <td class="col-name"><?= htmlspecialchars($row['person_name']) ?></td>
                                <td class="col-contact"><?= htmlspecialchars($row['contact']) ?></td>
                                <td class="col-address"><?= htmlspecialchars($row['address']) ?></td>
                                <td class="col-bgroup"><?= htmlspecialchars($row['blood_group']) ?></td>
                                <td class="col-units"><?= (int)$row['units'] ?></td>
                                <td class="col-source"><?= htmlspecialchars(ucfirst($row['submitted_by'])) ?></td>
                                <td class="col-status"><span class="badge <?= $statusClass ?>"><?= ucfirst($row['status']) ?></span></td>
                                <td class="col-date"><?= htmlspecialchars($row['request_date']) ?></td>
                                <td class="col-action">
                                    <?php if ($row['status'] === 'pending'): ?>
                                        <div class="action-group">
                                            <a class="btn btn-accept" href="?action=accept&id=<?= (int)$row['id'] ?>&type=<?= $typeParam ?>">Accept</a>
                                            <a class="btn btn-reject" href="?action=reject&id=<?= (int)$row['id'] ?>&type=<?= $typeParam ?>">Reject</a>
                                        </div>
                                    <?php else: ?>
                                        <span class="muted"><?= ucfirst($row['status']) ?></span>
                                    <?php endif; ?>
                                </td>
                            </tr>
                        <?php endwhile; ?>
                    <?php else: ?>
                        <tr><td colspan="11" class="text-center">No requests found.</td></tr>
                    <?php endif; ?>
                    </tbody>
                </table>
            </div>
        </section>
    </main>

    <footer id="page-footer">
        <small>Admin / Staff actions recorded. Page generated <?= date('Y-m-d H:i:s') ?></small>
    </footer>
</div>
</body>
</html>

2) styles.css

Save this as styles.css in the same folder (no inline CSS; only class/id selectors; uses px units).

css

3) (Optional) SQL to add status and submitted_by columns if missing

Run these once (via phpMyAdmin or MySQL client):

sql
-- Add status columns if they don't exist
ALTER TABLE blood_requests ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending';
ALTER TABLE donor_requests ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'pending';

-- Optionally track who submitted (admin or staff)
ALTER TABLE blood_requests ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS submitted_by VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'staff';
ALTER TABLE donor_requests ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS submitted_by VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'staff';

If your MySQL version doesn't support IF NOT EXISTS for ALTER TABLE ADD COLUMN, run a quick SHOW COLUMNS FROM table LIKE 'status' check before adding, or attempt to add and ignore the error if already present.

Notes & small improvements you may want

  • Right now the code expects submitted_by to contain either admin or staff. If you use user ids/roles, adjust the submitted_by display accordingly.

  • I used prepared statements for the updates to avoid SQL injection. The combined UNION ALL query is safe for read-only display here. If you need to filter or paginate, I can add that.

  • If you want the two request types visually separated in two side-by-side columns (instead of one wide table), I can provide a grid layout that renders two smaller tables (left: blood requests, right: donor requests) while still using the same single page.

If you want, I’ll:

  • Convert this single table into two visually separate tables on the same page (left/right), or

  • Add filter controls (by status, type, source), or

  • Add AJAX so Accept/Reject happens without reloading the page.

php
<?php
session_start();
if (!isset($_SESSION['user_id'])) {
    header("Location: loginpage.php");
    exit();
}
$mysqli = new mysqli("localhost","root","","bloodbank");
if ($mysqli->connect_error) {
    die("Connection failed: " . $mysqli->connect_error);
}
if (isset($_GET['action'], $_GET['id'], $_GET['type'])) {
    $id = (int)$_GET['id'];
    $action = $_GET['action'] === 'accept' ? 'accepted' : 'rejected';
    $type = $_GET['type'] === 'blood' ? 'blood' : 'donor';
    if ($type === 'blood') {
        $stmt = $mysqli->prepare("UPDATE blood_requests SET status = ? WHERE id = ?");
    } else {
        $stmt = $mysqli->prepare("UPDATE donor_requests SET status = ? WHERE id = ?");
    }
    if ($stmt) {
        $stmt->bind_param("si", $action, $id);
        $stmt->execute();
        $stmt->close();
    }
    header("Location: request_status.php");
    exit();
}
$query = "
    SELECT id,
           'Blood Request' AS req_type,
           COALESCE(name, entity_name, '') AS person_name,
           contact,
           address,
           blood_group,
           units,
           COALESCE(status, 'pending') AS status,
           request_date,
           COALESCE(submitted_by, 'unknown') AS submitted_by
    FROM blood_requests
    UNION ALL
    SELECT id,
           'Donor Request' AS req_type,
           COALESCE(donor_name, '') AS person_name,
           contact,
           address,
           blood_group,
           units,
           COALESCE(status, 'pending') AS status,
           request_date,
           COALESCE(submitted_by, 'unknown') AS submitted_by
    FROM donor_requests
    ORDER BY request_date DESC
";
$result = $mysqli->query($query);
?>

ChatGPT said:

Got it ✅ The error says:

sql
Unknown column 'submitted_by' in 'field list'

That means in your database tables (blood_requests / donor_requests) there is no column called submitted_by.

In the last code I gave you, I had included submitted_by (thinking you had it to track admin/staff). But since your tables don’t have it, you must remove it from the SQL and HTML.

    header("Location: loginpage.php");

if ($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error);

// Handle Approve/Reject
if (isset($_GET['action'], $_GET['id'], $_GET['type'])) {
    $id = (int)$_GET['id'];
    $action = $_GET['action'];
    $type = $_GET['type'];

    if ($type === 'blood') {
        if ($action === 'accept') {
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='accepted' WHERE id=$id");
        } elseif ($action === 'reject') {
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        }
    } elseif ($type === 'donor') {
        if ($action === 'accept') {
            $conn->query("UPDATE donor_requests SET status='accepted' WHERE id=$id");
        } elseif ($action === 'reject') {
            $conn->query("UPDATE donor_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        }
    }
    header("Location: request_status.php");
    exit();
}

// Fetch Blood Requests
$blood_result = $conn->query("
    SELECT id, name, entity_name, contact, address, blood_group, units, 
           IFNULL(status,'pending') as status, request_date
    FROM blood_requests
    ORDER BY request_date DESC
");

    SELECT id, donor_name, contact, blood_group, units,
           IFNULL(status,'pending') as status, request_date
    FROM donor_requests
    ORDER BY request_date DESC
");

ChatGPT said:

Shravani, I see what happened here 🙂

You pasted two different PHP pages together:

  1. The first part is your request_status.php (showing both blood requests + donor requests).

  2. The second part is another donor_requests.php admin page, with its own HTML <html>...</html> block.

That’s why it looks messy — you have two full HTML documents in one file.

✅ To fix this, you need one clean request_status.php that:

  • Handles blood requests

  • Handles donor requests

  • Uses one HTML page with two tables (Blood Requests + Donor Requests)

  • No duplicate <html> / <body>

Here’s a corrected single version for request_status.php (you don’t need the second block at all):

php
<?php
session_start();

$conn = new mysqli("localhost", "root", "", "bloodbank");
if ($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error);

// Handle Approve/Reject
if (isset($_GET['action'], $_GET['id'], $_GET['type'])) {
    $id = (int)$_GET['id'];
    $action = $_GET['action'];
    $type = $_GET['type'];

    $status = ($action === 'accept') ? 'accepted' : 'rejected';

    if ($type === 'blood') {
        $stmt = $conn->prepare("UPDATE blood_requests SET status=? WHERE id=?");
    } elseif ($type === 'donor') {
        $stmt = $conn->prepare("UPDATE donor_requests SET status=? WHERE id=?");
    }
    $stmt->bind_param("si", $status, $id);
    $stmt->execute();
    $stmt->close();

    header("Location: request_status.php");
    exit();
}

// Fetch Blood Requests
$blood_result = $conn->query("
    SELECT id, name, entity_name, contact, address, blood_group, units, 
           IFNULL(status,'pending') as status, request_date
    FROM blood_requests
    ORDER BY request_date DESC
");

// Fetch Donor Requests
$donor_result = $conn->query("
    SELECT id, donor_name, email, phone, dob, blood_group, last_donation, schedule_date, units,
           IFNULL(status,'pending') as status
    FROM donor_requests
    ORDER BY schedule_date DESC
");
?>
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>

ChatGPT said:

Yes Shravani 👍

The error you’re getting:

sql
Unknown column 'submitted_by' in 'field list'

means your database doesn’t have the column submitted_by but the code I gave earlier is trying to fetch it.

👉 So you need to create / update the database with the right structure. Here’s a simple SQL script you can run in phpMyAdmin → SQL tab (or from MySQL CLI) to create the necessary tables.

sql
CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS bloodbank;
USE bloodbank;

-- Table for blood requests
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS blood_requests (
    id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    entity_name VARCHAR(100),
    contact VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    address VARCHAR(255),
    blood_group VARCHAR(5) NOT NULL,
    units INT NOT NULL,
    status ENUM('pending','accepted','rejected') DEFAULT 'pending',
    request_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    submitted_by ENUM('admin','staff') DEFAULT 'admin'
);

-- Table for donor requests
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS donor_requests (
    id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    donor_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    age INT NOT NULL,
    blood_group VARCHAR(5) NOT NULL,
    contact VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    address VARCHAR(255),
    status ENUM('pending','accepted','rejected') DEFAULT 'pending',
    request_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    submitted_by ENUM('admin','staff') DEFAULT 'staff'
);

✅ This will create two tables:

  • blood_requests → for patients/hospitals requesting blood.

  • donor_requests → for donors requesting to donate.

Both include:

  • status (pending / accepted / rejected)

  • request_date

  • submitted_by (to track whether it was added by admin or staff)

ChatGPT said:

Got it ✅

You want two different status columns:

  • status_blood → for blood_requests

  • status_donor → for donor_requests

That way, they won’t conflict and you can clearly separate them.

🔹 Updated Database Structure

sql
-- Table: blood_requests
CREATE TABLE blood_requests (
    id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100),
    entity_name VARCHAR(100),
    contact VARCHAR(20),
    address TEXT,
    blood_group VARCHAR(10),
    units INT,
    status_blood ENUM('pending','accepted','rejected') DEFAULT 'pending',
    request_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- Table: donor_requests
CREATE TABLE donor_requests (
    id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY,
    donor_name VARCHAR(100),
    contact VARCHAR(20),
    blood_group VARCHAR(10),
    units INT,
    status_donor ENUM('pending','accepted','rejected') DEFAULT 'pending',
    request_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

🔹 PHP Code Changes

In your query for blood_requests, replace:

sql
IFNULL(status,'pending') as status

with

sql
IFNULL(status_blood,'pending') as status

👉 and in your query for donor_requests, replace:

sql
IFNULL(status,'pending') as status

with

sql
IFNULL(status_donor,'pending') as status

🔹 Update Action Handling

In PHP where you update:

php
$conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='accepted' WHERE id=$id");

👉 Change to:

php
$conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status_blood='accepted' WHERE id=$id");

And same for donor:

php
$conn->query("UPDATE donor_requests SET status_donor='accepted' WHERE id=$id");

⚡ This way, blood requests will always use status_blood and donor requests will always use status_donor.

Here’s a clean PHP page that shows only donor requests with their status, using status_donor as the status column.

donor_request_status.php

php
<?php
$conn = new mysqli("localhost", "root", "", "bloodbank");
if ($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error");

// Handle Approve/Reject
if (isset($_GET['action'], $_GET['id'])) {
    $id = (int)$_GET['id'];
    $action = $_GET['action'];
    $status = ($action === 'accept') ? 'accepted' : 'rejected';

    $stmt = $conn->prepare("UPDATE donor_requests SET status_donor=? WHERE id=?");
    $stmt->bind_param("si", $status, $id);
    $stmt->execute();
    $stmt->close();

    header("Location: donor_request_status.php");
    exit();
}

// Fetch donor requests
$result = $conn->query("
    SELECT id, donor_name, contact, blood_group, units, IFNULL(status_donor,'pending') as status, request_date
    FROM donor_requests
    ORDER BY request_date DESC
");
?>
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
<meta charset="UTF-8">
<title>Donor Requests Status</title>
<link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.3.2/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
<div class="container-custom">
    <h2>Donor Requests</h2>
    <div class="table-wrapper">
        <table class="custom-table">
            <thead>
                <tr>
                    <th>ID</th>
                    <th>Donor Name</th>
                    <th>Contact</th>
                    <th>Blood Group</th>
                    <th>Units</th>
                    <th>Status</th>
                    <th>Date</th>
                    <th>Action</th>
                </tr>
            </thead>
            <tbody>
            <?php while($row = $result->fetch_assoc()){ ?>
                <tr>
                    <td><?= $row['id'] ?></td>
                    <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['donor_name']) ?></td>
                    <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['contact']) ?></td>
                    <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['blood_group']) ?></td>
                    <td><?= $row['units'] ?></td>
                    <td><span class="badge-status badge-<?= $row['status'] ?>"><?= ucfirst($row['status']) ?></span></td>
                    <td><?= $row['request_date'] ?></td>
                    <td class="action-btns">
                        <?php if($row['status']=='pending'){ ?>
                        <a href="?action=accept&id=<?= $row['id'] ?>" class="btn btn-success btn-sm">Accept</a>
                        <a href="?action=reject&id=<?= $row['id'] ?>" class="btn btn-danger btn-sm">Reject</a>
                        <?php } else { echo "-"; } ?>
                    </td>
                </tr>
            <?php } ?>
            <?php if($result->num_rows==0){ ?>
                <tr><td colspan="8" class="text-center">No donor requests found.</td></tr>
            <?php } ?>
            </tbody>
        </table>
    </div>
</div>

A few notes to make this work correctly with your database:

1️⃣ Column Names

Make sure your donor_requests table has exactly these columns (or update the PHP to match your table):

Column NameTypeNotes
idINTPrimary Key, Auto Increment
donorNameVARCHAR(100)Donor full name
emailVARCHAR(100)Donor email
phoneVARCHAR(20)Contact number
dobDATEDate of Birth
blood_groupVARCHAR(5)Blood group
last_donationDATELast donation date (optional)
schedule_dateDATEScheduled donation date
unitsINTUnits donor will give
statusENUM'pending', 'approved', 'rejected'

If any column is missing (like donorName), PHP will throw Unknown column errors.

2️⃣ Status Updates

Your PHP handles approve/reject like this:

php
if(isset($_GET['action']) && isset($_GET['id'])){
    $id = (int)$_GET['id'];
    $status = ($_GET['action'] == 'approve') ? 'approved' : 'rejected';

    $stmt = $conn->prepare("UPDATE donor_requests SET status=? WHERE id=?");
    $stmt->bind_param("si", $status, $id);
    $stmt->execute();
    $stmt->close();

    header("Location: donor_requests.php"); // reload the page
    exit();
}

✅ This works if the column in your table is named status.

3️⃣ CSS

css

donor_request_status.php

php
<?php
$conn = new mysqli("localhost", "root", "", "bloodbank");
if ($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error");

// Handle Approve/Reject
if(isset($_GET['action'], $_GET['id'])){
    $id = (int)$_GET['id'];
    $status = ($_GET['action'] === 'approve') ? 'accepted' : 'rejected';

    $stmt = $conn->prepare("UPDATE donor_requests SET status_donor=? WHERE id=?");
    $stmt->bind_param("si", $status, $id);
    $stmt->execute();
    $stmt->close();

    header("Location: donor_request_status.php");
    exit();
}

// Fetch donor requests
$result = $conn->query("
    SELECT id, donor_name, email, phone, dob, blood_group, last_donation, schedule_date, units,
           IFNULL(status_donor,'pending') as status
    FROM donor_requests
    ORDER BY schedule_date DESC
");
?>
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
<meta charset="UTF-8">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
<title>Donor Requests Status</title>

<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">

                    <th>Name</th>
                    <th>Email</th>
                    <th>Phone</th>
                    <th>DOB</th>
                    <th>Blood Group</th>
                    <th>Last Donation</th>
                    <th>Schedule Date</th>
                    <th>Units</th>
                    <th>Status</th>
                    <th>Actions</th>
                </tr>
            </thead>
            <tbody>
            <?php if($result->num_rows > 0): ?>
                <?php while($row = $result->fetch_assoc()): ?>
                    <tr>
                        <td><?= $row['id'] ?></td>
                        <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['donor_name']) ?></td>
                        <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['email']) ?></td>
                        <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['phone']) ?></td>
                        <td><?= $row['dob'] ?></td>
                        <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['blood_group']) ?></td>

                        <td><?= $row['schedule_date'] ?></td>
                        <td><?= $row['units'] ?></td>
                        <td>
                            <?php
                                $badgeClass = match($row['status']) {
                                    'pending' => 'bg-warning text-dark',
                                    'accepted' => 'bg-success',
                                    'rejected' => 'bg-danger',
                                    default => 'bg-secondary'
                                };
                            ?>
                            <span class="badge <?= $badgeClass ?>"><?= ucfirst($row['status']) ?></span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                            <?php if($row['status']=='pending'): ?>
                                <a href="?action=approve&id=<?= $row['id'] ?>" class="btn btn-success btn-sm">Accept</a>
                                <a href="?action=reject&id=<?= $row['id'] ?>" class="btn btn-danger btn-sm">Reject</a>
                            <?php else: ?>
                                -
                            <?php endif; ?>
                        </td>
                    </tr>
                <?php endwhile; ?>

donor_request_status.php

php
<?php
$conn = new mysqli("localhost", "root", "", "bloodbank");
if ($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error);

// Fetch donor requests with status
$result = $conn->query("
    SELECT donor_name, blood_group, units, IFNULL(status_donor,'pending') as status, request_date
    FROM donor_requests
    ORDER BY request_date DESC
");
?>
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
<meta charset="UTF-8">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
<title>Donor Request Status</title>
<link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.3.2/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
</head>
<body>
<div class="container-custom">
    <h2>Donor Request Status</h2>
    <div class="table-wrapper">
        <table class="table table-bordered table-striped">
            <thead class="table-dark">
                <tr>
                    <th>Donor Name</th>
                    <th>Blood Group</th>
                    <th>Units</th>
                    <th>Status</th>
                    <th>Request Date</th>
                </tr>
            </thead>
            <tbody>
            <?php if($result->num_rows > 0): ?>
                <?php while($row = $result->fetch_assoc()): ?>
                    <tr>
                        <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['donor_name']) ?></td>
                        <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['blood_group']) ?></td>
                        <td><?= $row['units'] ?></td>
                        <td>
                            <?php
                                $badgeClass = match($row['status']) {
                                    'pending' => 'bg-warning text-dark',
                                    'accepted' => 'bg-success',
                                    'rejected' => 'bg-danger',
                                    default => 'bg-secondary'
                                };
                            ?>
                            <span class="badge <?= $badgeClass ?>"><?= ucfirst($row['status']) ?></span>
                        </td>
                        <td><?= $row['request_date'] ?></td>
                    </tr>
                <?php endwhile; ?>
            <?php else: ?>
                <tr><td colspan="5" class="text-center">No donor requests found.</td></tr>
            <?php endif; ?>
            </tbody>
        </table>
    </div>
</div>
</body>
</html>

ChatGPT said:

Ah, I see the problem with your current blood request approval code. The main issues are:

  1. Units check isn’t working reliably because your query trims blood group but sometimes it may have spaces or case differences.

  2. After approving, the status column may not update in the $results fetch because the query fetches before the update, and the page reload may not reflect changes immediately if caching or old $results are used.

Here’s a fixed, clean version of your blood request status page that integrates inventory check and shows proper approved/rejected/pending status immediately:

php
<?php
session_start();
if (!isset($_SESSION["loggedin"])) {
    header("Location: loginpage.php");
    exit();
}

$conn = new mysqli("localhost", "root", "", "bloodbank");
if ($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error);

// Handle approve/reject actions
if(isset($_POST['action'], $_POST['id'])){
    $id = (int)$_POST['id'];
    $action = $_POST['action'];

    $req = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests WHERE id=$id")->fetch_assoc();
    if($req && (is_null($req['status']) || strtolower(trim($req['status']))=='pending')){
        $bloodGroup = $conn->real_escape_string(trim($req['blood_group']));
        $unitsRequested = (int)$req['units'];

        $inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE blood_group='$bloodGroup'")->fetch_assoc();
        $availableUnits = $inv ? (int)$inv['units'] : 0;
        $inventoryId = $inv ? (int)$inv['id'] : 0;

        if($action=='approve'){
            if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){
                $conn->query("UPDATE inventory SET units = units - $unitsRequested WHERE id=$inventoryId");
                $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");
            } else {
                $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='pending' WHERE id=$id");
            }
        }

        if($action=='reject'){
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        }
    }
}

// Fetch updated requests AFTER any approval/rejection
$results = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests ORDER BY request_date DESC");
?>

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
<meta charset="UTF-8">
<title>Blood Requests Status</title>
<link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.3.2/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<style>
body {font-family:'Poppins',sans-serif; background:#f0f2f5;}
.container {max-width:1200px; margin:30px auto;}
h2 {color:#b71c1c; text-align:center; margin-bottom:20px;}
.table th, .table td {vertical-align: middle; font-size:14px; text-align:center;}
.btn {padding:5px 10px; font-size:13px;}
.status-pending {color: orange; font-weight: bold;}
.status-approved {color: green; font-weight: bold;}
.status-rejected {color: red; font-weight: bold;}
</style>
</head>
<body>
<div class="container mt-4">
<h2>Blood Requests Status</h2>
<table class="table table-bordered table-striped table-hover">
<thead class="table-dark">
<tr>
<th>ID</th>
<th>Name</th>
<th>Blood Group</th>
<th>Units</th>
<th>Request Date</th>
<th>Status</th>
<th>Action</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<?php if($results->num_rows > 0): ?>
    <?php while($row = $results->fetch_assoc()): 
        $status_clean = strtolower(trim($row['status'] ?? 'pending'));
    ?>
    <tr>
        <td><?= $row['id'] ?></td>
        <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['name']) ?></td>
        <td><?= htmlspecialchars($row['blood_group']) ?></td>
        <td><?= $row['units'] ?></td>
        <td><?= date("d-m-Y H:i", strtotime($row['request_date'])) ?></td>
        <td class="status-<?= $status_clean ?>"><?= ucfirst($status_clean) ?></td>
        <td>
            <?php if($status_clean=='pending'): ?>
            <form method="post" style="display:flex; gap:5px; justify-content:center;">
                <input type="hidden" name="id" value="<?= $row['id'] ?>">
                <button type="submit" name="action" value="approve" class="btn btn-success btn-sm">Approve</button>
                <button type="submit" name="action" value="reject" class="btn btn-danger btn-sm">Reject</button>
            </form>
            <?php elseif($status_clean=='approved'): ?>
            <span class="btn btn-success btn-sm disabled">Approved</span>
            <?php else: ?>
            <span class="btn btn-danger btn-sm disabled">Rejected</span>
            <?php endif; ?>
        </td>
    </tr>
    <?php endwhile; ?>
<?php else: ?>
<tr><td colspan="7" class="text-center">No requests found.</td></tr>
<?php endif; ?>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</body>
</html>

  4. Clean and readable bootstrap table with colored status.

Ah! Now I understand exactly what’s happening 😅. The issue is that your status in the database is not being saved properly or the code is checking the wrong value when deciding which buttons to show.

In your current code:

php
$status_clean = strtolower(trim($row['status'] ?? 'pending'));
if($status_clean=='pending'){ 
    // show approve/reject buttons
} elseif($status_clean=='approved'){ 
    // show approved label
} elseif($status_clean=='rejected'){ 
    // show rejected label
}

Why “Approved” shows rejected button

  1. Your database column might be status or status_blood or something else. If the column is not exactly status, $row['status'] will be NULL.

  2. trim() and strtolower() won’t fix it if the DB saved ' Approved ' with spaces — then $status_clean != 'approved'.

Fix

  1. Make sure your blood_requests table has a column named status (or adjust code).

  2. Use a strict check after trimming and lowercasing.

  3. Use fetch the latest value from DB after update.

Here’s a fixed code snippet for the status/action column:

php
<?php
$status_clean = strtolower(trim($row['status'] ?? 'pending'));
if($status_clean === 'pending'){ 
    echo "<form method='post' style='display:flex; gap:5px; justify-content:center;'>
            <input type='hidden' name='id' value='{$row['id']}'>
            <button type='submit' name='action' value='approve' class='btn btn-success btn-sm'>Approve</button>
            <button type='submit' name='action' value='reject' class='btn btn-danger btn-sm'>Reject</button>
          </form>";
} elseif($status_clean === 'approved'){ 
    echo "<span class='btn btn-success btn-sm disabled'>Approved</span>";
} elseif($status_clean === 'rejected'){ 
    echo "<span class='btn btn-danger btn-sm disabled'>Rejected</span>";
} else {
    echo "<span class='btn btn-secondary btn-sm disabled'>Pending</span>";
}
?>

if(isset($_POST['action'], $_POST['id'])){

Ah, I see exactly what’s happening now 😅. Don’t worry, we can fix it.

The problem is how the status is being updated and fetched:

  1. In your original code, you update the database:

php
$conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");

  1. Then, the same script fetches $results only once at the top, before the POST is processed.

So the page never sees the updated status.

Even if you added header("Location: request_status.php"); exit(); after updating, sometimes output has already started, preventing the header redirect.

Here’s a fully working approach:

php
<?php
session_start();
if (!isset($_SESSION["loggedin"])) {
    header("Location: loginpage.php");
    exit();
}

$conn = new mysqli("localhost", "root", "", "bloodbank");
if ($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: " . $conn->connect_error);

// Handle approve/reject actions
if(isset($_POST['action'], $_POST['id'])){
    $id = (int)$_POST['id'];
    $action = $_POST['action'];

    $req = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests WHERE id=$id")->fetch_assoc();
    if($req && (is_null($req['status']) || strtolower(trim($req['status']))=='pending')){
        $bloodGroup = $conn->real_escape_string(trim($req['blood_group']));
        $unitsRequested = (int)$req['units'];

        $inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE blood_group='$bloodGroup'")->fetch_assoc();
        $availableUnits = $inv ? (int)$inv['units'] : 0;
        $inventoryId = $inv ? (int)$inv['id'] : 0;

        if($action=='approve'){
            if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){

            }
        }

        if($action=='reject'){
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        }

        // Redirect immediately to refresh page and show updated status
        header("Location: request_status.php");
        exit();
    }
}

$results = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests ORDER BY request_date DESC");
?>

Key Fixes:

  1. Header redirect immediately after POST ensures the page reloads and fetches updated status.

  2. Fetch $results after any update, not before.

  3. Use exit(); after header() so the script stops and page reloads properly.

  • When you click Approve, the request shows Approved.

  • When you click Reject, it shows Rejected.

    $action = $_POST['action'];

    // Fetch the blood request

    if($req && (is_null($req['status']) || strtolower(trim($req['status']))=='pending')){
        $bloodGroup = $conn->real_escape_string(trim($req['blood_group']));
        $unitsRequested = (int)$req['units'];

        $inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE blood_group='$bloodGroup'")->fetch_assoc();

        $inventoryId = $inv ? (int)$inv['id'] : 0;

blood_request_action.php

php
<?php
session_start();
header('Content-Type: application/json');

if(!isset($_SESSION["loggedin"]) || $_SESSION["role"]!=="admin"){
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Unauthorized"]);
    exit();
}

if(!isset($_POST['id'], $_POST['action'])){
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Invalid request"]);
    exit();
}

$conn = new mysqli("localhost","root","","bloodbank");
if($conn->connect_error){
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"DB connection failed"]);
    exit();
}

$id = (int)$_POST['id'];
$action = $_POST['action'];

$req = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests WHERE id=$id")->fetch_assoc();
if(!$req){
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request not found"]);
    exit();
}

$status_clean = strtolower(trim($req['status'] ?? 'pending'));
if($status_clean !== 'pending'){
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request already processed"]);
    exit();
}

$bloodGroup = $conn->real_escape_string(trim($req['blood_group']));
$unitsRequested = (int)$req['units'];

$inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE blood_group='$bloodGroup'")->fetch_assoc();
$availableUnits = $inv ? (int)$inv['units'] : 0;
$inventoryId = $inv ? (int)$inv['id'] : 0;

if($action=='approve'){
    if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){
        $conn->query("UPDATE inventory SET units=units-$unitsRequested WHERE id=$inventoryId");
        $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");
        $newStatus = 'Approved';
    } else {
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Not enough units"]);
        exit();
    }
} elseif($action=='reject'){
    $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
    $newStatus = 'Rejected';
} else {
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Invalid action"]);
    exit();
}

// Return updated buttons and status
$buttons = ($newStatus==='Approved') 
    ? "<span class='btn btn-success btn-sm disabled'>Approved</span>" 
    : "<span class='btn btn-danger btn-sm disabled'>Rejected</span>";

echo json_encode(["success"=>true,"status"=>$newStatus,"buttons"=>$buttons]);

✅ What this does:

  • Admin clicks Approve or Reject → status updates instantly.

  • No page reload.

  • Inventory is decreased automatically on approval.

  • Buttons are replaced with a disabled Approved/Rejected label immediately.

If you want, I can also add a badge-style color for Pending/Approved/Rejected so it looks super clean in the admin panel.

<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
    $(".action-btn").click(function(){
        var id = $(this).data("id");
        var action = $(this).data("action");
        var row = $("#row-" + id);

        $.ajax({
            url: "blood_request_action.php",
            type: "POST",
            data: {id: id, action: action},
            dataType: "json",
            success: function(response){
                if(response.success){
                    row.find(".status-text").text(response.status);
                    row.find(".actions").html(response.buttons);
                } else {
                    alert(response.message);
                }
            },
            error: function(xhr, status, error){
                alert("AJAX error: " + error);
            }
        });
    });
});
</script>
</body>
</html>

<span class="btn btn-danger btn-sm disabled">Rejected</span>

2️⃣ blood_request_action.php

php
<?php
session_start();
header('Content-Type: application/json');

if(!isset($_SESSION["loggedin"]) || $_SESSION["role"]!=="admin"){
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Unauthorized"]);
    exit();
}

if(!isset($_POST['id'], $_POST['action'])){
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Invalid request"]);
    exit();
}

$conn = new mysqli("localhost","root","","bloodbank");
if($conn->connect_error){
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"DB connection failed"]);
    exit();
}

$id = (int)$_POST['id'];
$action = $_POST['action'];

// Fetch request
$req = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests WHERE id=$id")->fetch_assoc();
if(!$req){
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request not found"]);
    exit();
}

$status_clean = strtolower(trim($req['status'] ?? 'pending'));
if($status_clean !== 'pending'){
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request already processed"]);
    exit();
}

// Handle Inventory only if approved
$bloodGroup = $conn->real_escape_string(trim($req['blood_group']));
$unitsRequested = (int)$req['units'];
$inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE blood_group='$bloodGroup'")->fetch_assoc();
$availableUnits = $inv ? (int)$inv['units'] : 0;
$inventoryId = $inv ? (int)$inv['id'] : 0;

if($action=='approve'){
    if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){
        $conn->query("UPDATE inventory SET units=units-$unitsRequested WHERE id=$inventoryId");
        $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");
        $newStatus = 'Approved';
    } else {
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Not enough units"]);
        exit();
    }
}elseif($action=='reject'){
    $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
    $newStatus = 'Rejected';
}else{
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Invalid action"]);
    exit();
}

// Return buttons for updated status
$buttons = ($newStatus==='Approved') 
    ? "<span class='btn btn-success btn-sm disabled'>Approved</span>" 
    : "<span class='btn btn-danger btn-sm disabled'>Rejected</span>";

echo json_encode(["success"=>true,"status"=>$newStatus,"buttons"=>$buttons]);

✅ Features:

  • Approve/Reject buttons update instantly without page reload.

  • Inventory units decrease only when blood request is approved.

  • Status column updates immediately.

  • Disabled buttons appear for already processed requests.

If you want, I can also add a visual indicator if not enough units without blocking the panel.

Do you want me to add that?

Ah! Let me explain clearly: in this code, you don’t need to open a new page or submit a form manually. The “Actions” column buttons (Approve / Reject) already handle everything using AJAX.

Here’s how it works:

  1. Buttons in the table:

html
<button class="btn btn-success btn-sm action-btn" data-id="<?= $row['id'] ?>" data-action="approve">Approve</button>
<button class="btn btn-danger btn-sm action-btn" data-id="<?= $row['id'] ?>" data-action="reject">Reject</button>

  • data-id → the ID of the blood request.

  • data-action → "approve" or "reject".

  1. AJAX call (inside <script> in admin_blood_requests.php):

js
$(".action-btn").click(function(){
    var id = $(this).data("id");
    var action = $(this).data("action");
    var row = $("#row-"+id);

    $.ajax({
        url: "blood_request_action.php",
        type: "POST",
        data: {id:id, action:action},
        dataType: "json",
        success: function(response){
            if(response.success){
                row.find(".status-text").text(response.status);
                row.find(".actions").html(response.buttons);
            } else {
                alert(response.message);
            }
        }
    });
});

  • When you click Approve or Reject, AJAX sends the request to blood_request_action.php.

  • That PHP file updates the status in the database (and updates inventory if approved).

  • Then it returns the new status text and updated buttons, which are updated in the table without reloading the page.

✅ So for “Action,” you just click the Approve or Reject button, and it will automatically:

  • Update the request status in the database.

  • Reduce inventory (if approved).

  • Change the button and status text in the table.

No extra forms or page loads are needed.

            error: function(xhr,status,error){

<?php
// Handle AJAX request
if(isset($_POST['ajax_id'], $_POST['ajax_action'])){
    $id = (int)$_POST['ajax_id'];
    $action = $_POST['ajax_action'];

    // Fetch request
    $req = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests WHERE id=$id")->fetch_assoc();
    if(!$req){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request not found"]);
        exit();
    }

    $status_clean = strtolower(trim($req['status'] ?? 'pending'));
    if($status_clean!=='pending'){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request already processed"]);
        exit();
    }

    // Inventory check for approve
    $bloodGroup = $conn->real_escape_string(trim($req['blood_group']));
    $unitsRequested = (int)$req['units'];
    $inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE blood_group='$bloodGroup'")->fetch_assoc();
    $availableUnits = $inv ? (int)$inv['units'] : 0;
    $inventoryId = $inv ? (int)$inv['id'] : 0;

    if($action=='approve'){
        if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){
            $conn->query("UPDATE inventory SET units=units-$unitsRequested WHERE id=$inventoryId");
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");
            $newStatus = 'Approved';
        } else {
            echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Not enough units"]);
            exit();
        }
    } elseif($action=='reject'){
        $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        $newStatus = 'Rejected';
    } else {
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Invalid action"]);
        exit();
    }

    $buttons = ($newStatus==='Approved') 
        ? "<span class='btn btn-success btn-sm disabled'>Approved</span>" 
        : "<span class='btn btn-danger btn-sm disabled'>Rejected</span>";

    echo json_encode(["success"=>true,"status"=>$newStatus,"buttons"=>$buttons]);
    exit();
}
?>

You said:
AJAX Error: SyntaxError: Unexpected token '<', "<!DOCTYPE "... is not valid JSON
ChatGPT said:

Ah! That error happens when the AJAX expects JSON, but the server is returning HTML instead (usually the page HTML itself). In your single-file code, the problem is the PHP that handles the AJAX request is outputting HTML above the JSON, or the AJAX is called before PHP handles POST, so the page HTML is returned instead of JSON.

We can fix it by:

  1. Handling AJAX requests at the very top of the PHP file before any HTML output.

  2. Calling exit() after echo json_encode(...) so no other HTML is sent.

Here’s the corrected structure:

php
<?php
session_start();
if(!isset($_SESSION["loggedin"]) || $_SESSION["role"]!=="admin"){
    header("Location: loginpage.php");
    exit();
}

$conn = new mysqli("localhost","root","","bloodbank");
if($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: ".$conn->connect_error);

// --- AJAX Handler --- must be BEFORE any HTML output
if(isset($_POST['ajax_id'], $_POST['ajax_action'])){
    header('Content-Type: application/json'); // important
    $id = (int)$_POST['ajax_id'];
    $action = $_POST['ajax_action'];

    $req = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests WHERE id=$id")->fetch_assoc();
    if(!$req){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request not found"]); exit();
    }

    $status_clean = strtolower(trim($req['status'] ?? 'pending'));
    if($status_clean!=='pending'){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request already processed"]); exit();
    }

    // Inventory check for approve
    $bloodGroup = $conn->real_escape_string(trim($req['blood_group']));
    $unitsRequested = (int)$req['units'];
    $inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE blood_group='$bloodGroup'")->fetch_assoc();
    $availableUnits = $inv ? (int)$inv['units'] : 0;
    $inventoryId = $inv ? (int)$inv['id'] : 0;

    if($action=='approve'){
        if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){
            $conn->query("UPDATE inventory SET units=units-$unitsRequested WHERE id=$inventoryId");
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");
            $newStatus = 'Approved';
        } else {
            echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Not enough units"]); exit();
        }
    } elseif($action=='reject'){
        $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        $newStatus = 'Rejected';
    } else {
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Invalid action"]); exit();
    }

    $buttons = ($newStatus==='Approved') 
        ? "<span class='btn btn-success btn-sm disabled'>Approved</span>" 
        : "<span class='btn btn-danger btn-sm disabled'>Rejected</span>";

    echo json_encode(["success"=>true,"status"=>$newStatus,"buttons"=>$buttons]);
    exit();
}

// --- Normal page load continues here ---
$results = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests ORDER BY request_date DESC");
?>

Key fixes:

  1. AJAX handling before any HTML.

  2. header('Content-Type: application/json'); ensures the browser knows it’s JSON.

  3. Every echo json_encode() is followed by exit() to stop HTML from being sent.

✅ With this, your AJAX buttons will work properly and won’t throw the Unexpected token '<' error.

<script>
$(document).ready(function(){
    $(".action-btn").click(function(){
        var id = $(this).data("id");
        var action = $(this).data("action");
        var row = $("#row-"+id);

        $.ajax({
            url: "", // same page
            type: "POST",
            data: {ajax_id:id, ajax_action:action},
            dataType: "json",
            success: function(response){
                if(response.success){
                    row.find(".status-text").text(response.status);
                    row.find(".actions").html(response.buttons);
                } else {
                    alert(response.message);
                }
            },
            error: function(xhr,status,error){
                alert("AJAX Error: "+error);
            }
        });
    });
});
</script>

You said:
20 units are vable bt shpwing 1
ChatGPT said:

Ah! That explains it — the issue is almost certainly data type or string/space mismatch in your inventory check:

php
$inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE TRIM(blood_group)='$bloodGroup'")->fetch_assoc();

Common causes for “only 1 unit available” despite 20 in DB:

  1. units column is stored as VARCHAR instead of INT → PHP treats it as string, and arithmetic may behave unexpectedly.

  2. blood_group in DB has trailing spaces or different casing → TRIM() helps, but maybe it’s still not exact.

  3. Using $inv['units'] directly without converting to int → PHP can miscalculate 1 vs 20.

✅ Fix: cast units to int and make sure subtraction is correct:

php
$availableUnits = intval($inv['units']); // ensures numeric value
$unitsRequested = intval($req['units']); // requested units

if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){
    $conn->query("UPDATE inventory SET units = units - $unitsRequested WHERE id = $inventoryId");
    $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");
    $newStatus = 'Approved';
} else {
    echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Not enough units. Available: $availableUnits"]); exit();
}

Also, make sure the inventory.units column is numeric (INT) in your database, not VARCHAR. You can check via SQL:

sql
DESCRIBE inventory;

If units is VARCHAR, run:

sql
ALTER TABLE inventory MODIFY units INT NOT NULL;

Ah! I see exactly what’s happening. The warnings and fatal errors are because of this part at the very top of your code:

Here’s the clean, fixed version of your admin blood requests page using AJAX:

php
<?php
session_start();
if(!isset($_SESSION["loggedin"]) || $_SESSION["role"]!=="admin"){
    header("Location: loginpage.php");
    exit();
}

$conn = new mysqli("localhost","root","","bloodbank");
if($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: ".$conn->connect_error);

// --- AJAX Handler ---
if(isset($_POST['ajax_id'], $_POST['ajax_action'])){
    header('Content-Type: application/json');
    $id = (int)$_POST['ajax_id'];
    $action = $_POST['ajax_action'];

    $req = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests WHERE id=$id")->fetch_assoc();
    if(!$req){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request not found"]); exit();
    }

    $status_clean = strtolower(trim($req['status'] ?? 'pending'));
    if($status_clean!=='pending'){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request already processed"]); exit();
    }

    $bloodGroup = $conn->real_escape_string(trim($req['blood_group']));
    $unitsRequested = intval($req['units']);

    $inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE TRIM(blood_group)='$bloodGroup'")->fetch_assoc();
    if(!$inv){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"No units available for $bloodGroup"]); exit();
    }

    $availableUnits = intval($inv['units']);
    $inventoryId = intval($inv['id']);

    if($action=='approve'){
        if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){
            $conn->query("UPDATE inventory SET units = units - $unitsRequested WHERE id=$inventoryId");
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");
            $newStatus = 'Approved';
        } else {
            echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Not enough units. Available: $availableUnits"]); exit();
        }
    } elseif($action=='reject'){
        $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        $newStatus = 'Rejected';
    } else {
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Invalid action"]); exit();
    }

    $buttons = ($newStatus==='Approved') 
        ? "<span class='btn btn-success btn-sm disabled'>Approved</span>" 
        : "<span class='btn btn-danger btn-sm disabled'>Rejected</span>";

    echo json_encode(["success"=>true,"status"=>$newStatus,"buttons"=>$buttons]);
    exit();

php
<?php
session_start();
if(!isset($_SESSION["loggedin"]) || $_SESSION["role"]!=="admin"){
    header("Location: loginpage.php");
    exit();
}

$conn = new mysqli("localhost","root","","bloodbank");
if($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: ".$conn->connect_error);

// --- AJAX Handler ---
if(isset($_POST['ajax_id'], $_POST['ajax_action'])){
    header('Content-Type: application/json');
    $id = (int)$_POST['ajax_id'];
    $action = $_POST['ajax_action'];

    $req = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests WHERE id=$id")->fetch_assoc();
    if(!$req){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request not found"]); exit();
    }

    $status_clean = strtolower(trim($req['status'] ?? 'pending'));
    if($status_clean!=='pending'){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request already processed"]); exit();
    }

    $bloodGroup = $conn->real_escape_string(trim($req['blood_group']));
    $unitsRequested = intval($req['units']);

    $inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE TRIM(blood_group)='$bloodGroup'")->fetch_assoc();
    if(!$inv){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"No units available for $bloodGroup"]); exit();
    }

    $availableUnits = intval($inv['units']);
    $inventoryId = intval($inv['id']);

    if($action=='approve'){
        if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){
            $conn->query("UPDATE inventory SET units = units - $unitsRequested WHERE id=$inventoryId");
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");
            $newStatus = 'Approved';
        } else {
            echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Not enough units. Available: $availableUnits"]); exit();
        }
    } elseif($action=='reject'){
        $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        $newStatus = 'Rejected';
    } else {
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Invalid action"]); exit();
    }

    $buttons = ($newStatus==='Approved') 
        ? "<span class='btn btn-success btn-sm disabled'>Approved</span>" 
        : "<span class='btn btn-danger btn-sm disabled'>Rejected</span>";

    echo json_encode(["success"=>true,"status"=>$newStatus,"buttons"=>$buttons]);
    exit();
}

listen its shwoing 1 uit where in inventory thre is 20 units
ChatGPT said:

Ah! Now I understand exactly what’s happening — the issue is with how the inventory is being fetched in the query.

Right now, your query:

sql
SELECT r.*, i.units as available_units 
FROM blood_requests r
LEFT JOIN inventory i ON TRIM(r.blood_group) = TRIM(i.blood_group)
ORDER BY r.request_date DESC

If your inventory table has blood_group with extra spaces or inconsistent case, the TRIM() may not fully match, or the join may return multiple rows incorrectly. That’s why it shows “1” instead of “20”.

Also, make sure your inventory units column is numeric (INT) and not VARCHAR.

Here’s a safe version that works correctly:

php
// Fetch blood requests with available units
$results = $conn->query("
    SELECT r.*, 
           (SELECT units FROM inventory WHERE TRIM(blood_group)=TRIM(r.blood_group) LIMIT 1) AS available_units
    FROM blood_requests r
    ORDER BY r.request_date DESC
");

✅ Why this works:

  • Uses a subquery to fetch the exact units from inventory for each request.

  • LIMIT 1 ensures only one row is returned.

  • TRIM() handles extra spaces in blood_group.

  • Prevents incorrect joins that might show “1” or random values.

Also, make sure your inventory table looks like this:

idblood_groupunitsdate_added
1A+20...
2B+10...

units must be INT, not VARCHAR.

If you want, I can rewrite the full admin blood request page with this fix, so it shows requested units, available units correctly, and approve/reject works via AJAX.

$(document).ready(function(){
    $(".action-btn").click(function(){
        var id = $(this).data("id");
        var action = $(this).data("action");
        var row = $("#row-"+id);

        $.ajax({
            url: "", // same page
            type: "POST",
            data: {ajax_id:id, ajax_action:action},
            dataType: "json",
            success: function(response){
                if(response.success){
                    row.find(".status-text").text(response.status);
                    row.find(".actions").html(response.buttons);
                    // Update available units immediately
                    var availableCell = row.find("td").eq(4);
                    if(action === "approve"){
                        var newUnits = parseInt(availableCell.text()) - parseInt(row.find("td").eq(3).text());
                        availableCell.text(newUnits);
                    }
                } else {
                    alert(response.message);
                }
            },
            error: function(xhr,status,error){
                alert("AJAX Error: "+error);
            }
        });
    });
});
</script>

ChatGPT said:

Ah! I see exactly what’s happening now. The issue is not with your inventory table, it’s with how the available units are displayed in your Blood Requests table. Right now, you’re fetching available_units once on page load, and after approving a request, the AJAX updates the cell only in the DOM. The value is calculated as:

js
var newUnits = parseInt(availableCell.text()) - parseInt(row.find("td").eq(3).text());
availableCell.text(newUnits);

This works only for one request, and can get out of sync if multiple requests exist or if units are already updated in DB by another process.

Also, the Requested Units (td:eq(3)) is correct, but it’s not reflected in the DB for showing remaining inventory dynamically in your table after multiple approvals.

Here’s the robust solution:

  1. After AJAX approval, return the updated inventory units from the server instead of calculating in JS.

  2. Update the table cell directly with the actual DB value, so it never goes wrong.

Modify the PHP AJAX section like this:

php
if($action === 'approve'){
    if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){
        $conn->query("UPDATE inventory SET units=units-$unitsRequested WHERE id=$inventoryId");
        $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");

        // Fetch updated units from DB
        $updatedInventory = $conn->query("SELECT units FROM inventory WHERE id=$inventoryId")->fetch_assoc();
        $availableUnits = intval($updatedInventory['units']);

        $newStatus = 'Approved';
    } else {
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Not enough units. Available: $availableUnits"]); exit();
    }
}

Then in your AJAX success function, replace:

js
var availableCell = row.find("td").eq(4);
if(action === "approve"){
    var newUnits = parseInt(availableCell.text()) - parseInt(row.find("td").eq(3).text());
    availableCell.text(newUnits);
}

with:

js
row.find("td").eq(4).text(response.available_units);

And in the JSON response, include available_units:

php
echo json_encode([
    "success" => true,
    "status" => $newStatus,
    "buttons" => $buttons,
    "available_units" => $availableUnits
]);

✅ This way:

  • Requested Units stays the same.

  • Available Units always reflects actual units in inventory, even after multiple approvals.

  • No JS calculations — all DB-driven.

If you want, I can rewrite your full Blood Requests Admin panel with this fix so that approve/reject works perfectly and the units always stay correct.

Do you want me to do that?

ChatGPT said:

Got it! You want a full admin panel Blood Requests code where:

  1. Requested units are checked against available inventory.

  2. Approve is only allowed if enough units exist.

  3. Reject works normally.

  4. After approval, both the status and available units update in real-time (AJAX).

  5. No page reload is needed.

Here’s a complete working code:

php
<?php
session_start();
if(!isset($_SESSION["loggedin"]) || $_SESSION["role"]!=="admin"){
    header("Location: loginpage.php");
    exit();
}

$conn = new mysqli("localhost","root","","bloodbank");
if($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: ".$conn->connect_error);

// --- AJAX Handler for Approve/Reject ---
if(isset($_POST['ajax_id'], $_POST['ajax_action'])){
    header('Content-Type: application/json');

    $id = (int)$_POST['ajax_id'];
    $action = $_POST['ajax_action'];

    // Fetch the request
    $req = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests WHERE id=$id")->fetch_assoc();
    if(!$req){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request not found"]);
        exit();
    }

    $status_clean = strtolower(trim($req['status'] ?? 'pending'));
    if($status_clean !== 'pending'){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request already processed"]);
        exit();
    }

    $bloodGroup = $conn->real_escape_string(trim($req['blood_group']));
    $unitsRequested = intval($req['units']);

    // Fetch inventory for that blood group
    $inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE TRIM(blood_group)='$bloodGroup' LIMIT 1")->fetch_assoc();
    if(!$inv){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"No units available for $bloodGroup"]);
        exit();
    }

    $availableUnits = intval($inv['units']);
    $inventoryId = intval($inv['id']);

    if($action === 'approve'){
        if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){
            // Update inventory
            $conn->query("UPDATE inventory SET units=units-$unitsRequested WHERE id=$inventoryId");
            // Update request
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");
            $newStatus = 'Approved';

            // Fetch updated units
            $updatedInventory = $conn->query("SELECT units FROM inventory WHERE id=$inventoryId")->fetch_assoc();
            $availableUnits = intval($updatedInventory['units']);
        } else {
            echo json_encode([
                "success"=>false,
                "message"=>"Not enough units available. Requested: $unitsRequested, Available: $availableUnits"
            ]);
            exit();
        }
    } elseif($action === 'reject'){
        $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        $newStatus = 'Rejected';
    } else {
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Invalid action"]);
        exit();
    }

    $buttons = ($newStatus === 'Approved') 
        ? "<span class='btn btn-success btn-sm disabled'>Approved</span>" 
        : "<span class='btn btn-danger btn-sm disabled'>Rejected</span>";

    echo json_encode([
        "success"=>true,
        "status"=>$newStatus,
        "buttons"=>$buttons,
        "available_units"=>$availableUnits
    ]);
    exit();
}

    FROM blood_requests r
    ORDER BY r.request_date DESC

Exactly — the issue is that your query is returning the wrong row from inventory (showing 1 unit) instead of 20. This usually happens because of whitespace or casing mismatches between blood_group in blood_requests and inventory, or because there are duplicate entries in inventory.

To fix it:

  1. Use a BINARY comparison to match blood groups exactly:

php
$results = $conn->query("
    SELECT r.*, 
           (SELECT units 
            FROM inventory 
            WHERE BINARY TRIM(blood_group) = BINARY TRIM(r.blood_group) 
            LIMIT 1) AS available_units
    FROM blood_requests r
    ORDER BY r.request_date DESC
");

  1. Check your inventory table to make sure there’s only one row per blood group. Duplicate entries can cause LIMIT 1 to return the wrong value.

  2. Ensure there are no hidden spaces in your database entries for blood_group. For example:

sql
SELECT CONCAT('"', blood_group, '"'), units FROM inventory;

This will show any trailing spaces.

Got it! Here's a complete, corrected admin blood requests page with proper handling of:

  • Displaying requested units vs available units

php
<?php
session_start();
if(!isset($_SESSION["loggedin"]) || $_SESSION["role"] !== "admin"){
    header("Location: loginpage.php");
    exit();
}

$conn = new mysqli("localhost","root","","bloodbank");
if($conn->connect_error) die("Connection failed: ".$conn->connect_error);

// --- AJAX Handler for Approve/Reject ---
if(isset($_POST['ajax_id'], $_POST['ajax_action'])){
    header('Content-Type: application/json');
    $id = (int)$_POST['ajax_id'];
    $action = $_POST['ajax_action'];

    // Fetch request
    $req = $conn->query("SELECT * FROM blood_requests WHERE id=$id")->fetch_assoc();
    if(!$req){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request not found"]); exit();
    }

    $status_clean = strtolower(trim($req['status'] ?? 'pending'));
    if($status_clean !== 'pending'){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Request already processed"]); exit();
    }

    $bloodGroup = $conn->real_escape_string(trim($req['blood_group']));
    $unitsRequested = intval($req['units']);

    // Fetch inventory for that blood group
    $inv = $conn->query("SELECT id, units FROM inventory WHERE BINARY TRIM(blood_group)=BINARY '$bloodGroup' LIMIT 1")->fetch_assoc();
    if(!$inv){
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"No units available for $bloodGroup"]); exit();
    }

    $availableUnits = intval($inv['units']);
    $inventoryId = intval($inv['id']);

    if($action === 'approve'){
        if($availableUnits >= $unitsRequested){
            $conn->query("UPDATE inventory SET units=units-$unitsRequested WHERE id=$inventoryId");
            $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='approved' WHERE id=$id");
            $newStatus = 'Approved';
        } else {
            echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Not enough units. Requested: $unitsRequested, Available: $availableUnits"]); exit();
        }
    } elseif($action === 'reject'){
        $conn->query("UPDATE blood_requests SET status='rejected' WHERE id=$id");
        $newStatus = 'Rejected';
    } else {
        echo json_encode(["success"=>false,"message"=>"Invalid action"]); exit();
    }

    $buttons = ($newStatus === 'Approved') 
        ? "<span class='btn btn-success btn-sm disabled'>Approved</span>" 
        : "<span class='btn btn-danger btn-sm disabled'>Rejected</span>";

    echo json_encode(["success"=>true,"status"=>$newStatus,"buttons"=>$buttons,"remaining_units"=>$availableUnits]);
    exit();
}
